revised_title: Observations of the Total Solar Eclipse of August 29, 1886, in Grenada
tldr: The author reports on the observations of the total solar eclipse of August 29, 1886, in Grenada. The study aimed to confirm Mr. Lockyer's observations of the chromosphere and inner corona. The findings support the new hypothesis of the solar atmosphere's composition and structure, with different strata having distinct compositions and temperatures.
